This is a projected image of the Sun during the transit of Venus (dark blob at the top) across the Sun in June 5 of 2012. The misty appearance is caused by…
objects.photodata:
Creator JCP

Title Projected Sun and clouds - 2012 Venus transit.

Description This is a projected image of the Sun during the transit of Venus (dark blob at the top) across the Sun in June 5 of 2012. The misty appearance is caused by passing clouds. The non-circular outline is caused by the light rays from the telescope reaching the screen at an oblique angle, as well as the view of the screen being oblique.

Original Date 6/5/12, 6:33 PM

Make Canon

Camera Canon EOS DIGITAL REBEL XT

Focal Length (35mm) 87mm

Metering Mode Multi-segment

ISO Equivalent 400

Exposure Time 1/250s

Aperture ƒ/10.0

Exposure bias 0 EV

Exposure Program Program normal

White balance Auto white balance

Flash Flash did not fire

Resolution 2496 x 1664

objects.photodata:
Creator JCP

Title The Sun on July 16, 2015

Description The Sun on July 16, 2015. Projected on a screen using the Celestron 6-inch. This was during sunspot cycle 24, which had about half as many sunspots as the previous cycle. Some sunspots are visible but the Sun was dropping towards the 2020 minimum.

Original Date 7/16/15, 1:18 PM

Make Canon

Camera Canon EOS DIGITAL REBEL XT

Focal Length (35mm) 89mm

Metering Mode Multi-segment

ISO Equivalent 400

Exposure Time 1/400s

Aperture ƒ/14.0

Exposure bias 0 EV

Exposure Program Program normal

White balance Auto white balance

Flash Flash did not fire

Resolution 1030 x 1026

objects.photodata:
Creator JCP

Title The Sun through the H alpha telescope on 3/8/16.

Description The Sun through the H alpha (SolarMax II) telescope on 3/8/16. A bright prominence is visible at the bottom right. Dark filaments and brighter faculae are real features on the Sun, but some of the darker dots are not actually on the Sun. The misty appearance of the top right is not part of the Sun.

Original Date 3/8/16, 7:40 PM

Make Canon

Camera Canon EOS DIGITAL REBEL XT

Focal Length (35mm) 0mm

Flash Flash did not fire

Resolution 2361 x 1496

Prominence on the Sun, Mar 8, 2016. Taken with the Canon T5i on the Coronado SolarMax II H-alpha telescope. These H-alpha telescope have a wavelength tuning…
objects.photodata:
Creator JCP

Title Prominence on the Sun, Prominance on the Sun, Mar 8, 2016.

Description Prominence on the Sun, Mar 8, 2016. Taken with the Canon T5i on the Coronado SolarMax II H-alpha telescope. These H-alpha telescope have a wavelength tuning filter which can give a wide variety of appearances. In this case, the main body of the Sun has little detail, but the prominences are visible along the bottom.

Original Date 3/8/16, 7:40 PM

Make Canon

Camera Canon EOS DIGITAL REBEL XT

Focal Length (35mm) 0mm

Metering Mode Multi-segment

ISO Equivalent 200

Exposure Time 1.0s

Aperture ƒ/∞

Exposure bias 0 EV

Exposure Program Manual control

White balance Auto white balance

Flash Flash did not fire

Resolution 2496 x 1664

Featureless Sun!? 5/14/19. Granted, this was near the sunspot minimum, but some settings of the Coronado SolarMax II do not show much detail even when it is…
objects.photodata:
Creator JCP

Title Featureless Sun!? 5/14/19

Description Featureless Sun!? 5/14/19. Granted, this was near the sunspot minimum, but some settings of the Coronado SolarMax II do not show much detail even when it is present. This image was created by stacking multiple frames from a video - some alignment imperfections persist on the edges of the image.

Original Date 5/14/19, 3:17 PM

Make Canon

Camera Canon EOS REBEL T5i

Lens 0.0 mm

Focal Length 0 mm

Metering Mode Center weighted average

ISO Equivalent 6400

Resolution 2008 x 1199
